WRITING.TITLE: Full or Partial suit?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm kinda new to the fandom, well, I've been a long time anthro fan, but I only really started considering myself a furry once I decided I want a fursuit. I don't know if it's just me, but I've noticed that when people talk about fursuits and fursuit making, and they talk about whether you should have a full or partial, it's always worded as if a full suit should eventually be your end goal, or like if you can't get a full suit for whatever reason, a partial is "the next best thing" rather than an equal alternative. I'm just wondering if I'm just noticing something that isn't there, or if there is a small bias against partial suits. It's also like, people in full suits tend to be more popular than those in partials. I'm wondering if others have noticed the same thing? Also, weather or not you have a suit, or even want one, you've probably got a preference - What do you prefer the look of? Partial or full? Personally, I prefer the look of full suits but if I'm not sure if I would wear a full suit or a partial with a fish patterned kaftan that I own but have never worn. I'm leaning towards partial, also because I have to make it myself (unfortunately)

WRITING.TITLE: What world/reality does your fursona(s) live in?
WRITING.TEXT: Talking with a friend got me thinking about this last night. Obviously in our reality, there are no anthros, there are only people and animals. But for your 'sona to exist, they need to exist *somewhere*. In your mind, even if they live in a world just like ours, it's different somehow. What are those differences? They could be from another planet. What's the planet like, are there other anthro races or humans there? Maybe it's a fantasy reality where humans never existed, and all the anthro races live normal human lives, just with added fur, scales and feathers? What is ***your*** reality? For Susim, she lives in a weird reality where there are animals, there are humans, and there are "pets" who are anthro. "Pets" are treated by humans, their owners, mostly as pets, or like some people in our reality treat their pets, like children. Kind of like stewie from family guy, the owners will hear their pet saying something, but they won't really take notice unless it's really simple, like "I'm hungry, I'm sad, I'm bored, I love you" Even adult pets tend to act like perpetual teenagers, because they're very rarely given any responsibility or true freedom. There are some "pets" living in the world independently, and the owners call them strays. Owners are annoyed by them, but often they're idolised by pets who wish for a free life, but are too scared to leave their comfortable life been cared for. Susim doesn't want to be a stray (she loves her owner) but she likes hanging out with strays occasionally, when she escapes the house.

WRITING.TITLE: Secondary 'sona in progress.
Furcadia, anyone?
WRITING.TEXT: Does anyone else here play, or has ever played furcadia? I've been playing on and off for over 10 years (literally scares the fuck out of me to type that. Man, I'm getting old) What's your most memorable experience on the game? ~ For me, it was that time that I'm not so proud about... I was 14 or 15 (possibly 13, I don't really remember), and I met a guy, who was 19, his name was Kiyo White Fox and we got close. I told him I was 17. He role-play kissed me, and I told him the truth and he was... understandably hurt. He wouldn't talk to me after that but I never forgot him. Kiyo, I was ShayFox and if you happen to be on this reddit, and read this - I'm sorry. No excuses, I'm just so sorry.

Orcish wedding ceremonies.
WRITING.TEXT: The Elder Scrolls games have been part of our relationship since the beginning. We're planning to marry in about 2 years and are still considering themes, but Elder Scrolls is at the top of the list, and the idea is to blend marriage conventions from our two favourite races. My partner generally plays as, and enjoys the culture of Nords, but we know their wedding conventions through Skyrim. (and a little from ESO) I, on the other hand, strongly identify as an Orc (character wise). I know the strongholds ship off their girls and the chief has a bunch of wives and stuff, but does anyone know what an actual wedding ceremony in a stronghold looks like? I can't imagine the girl just rocks up to her new stronghold and the chief is like "hey" and that's it. There must be some kind of 'event'. So far we only have what they've got in common, snow, ale and fighting. But what are the differences? I've googled around a bit and can't really find anything, but most probably I just suck at it, please help me! Thank you!

WRITING.TITLE: I started working out and didn't want to suffer alone, so made my sona work out too.
[Rant] Wedding planning is making me unnecessarily hostile and I don't like it.
WRITING.TEXT: I don't know if I've just overdosed on other peoples bad wedding experiences and I'm just trying to shut that shit down before it happens to us, but the other day my FH's mother kept bringing up moving the date "to make things easier for guests who work" after I'd repeatedly told her the date was important to us. Honestly it's the *most* important thing about the wedding, to us. I do understand what she means, it's on a monday and if people want to come to the ceremony AND the reception, and stay late and drink they'll probably have to book those two days off. But honestly we didn't even *want* a reception, my FH just couldn't say no to his mum's offer of financial help (but that's another matter...) I basically told her if people didn't think our wedding was important enough to book a day off (we're in the UK, everyone gets a minimum amount of holidays by law so no excuses there, and the wedding is just under a year away so plenty of time to book ahead) then why would we want them there at all? and that the wedding is one day, but the date will be our anniversary forever. Now I just feel mean, she means well, she's actually really nice, she's such a "mum" you know what I mean? like she just wants to make everyone happy all the time, and I know she wasn't trying to start anything or take over, but until now me and FH had planned everything ourselves and were happy but now we're having a proper reception and ceremony and it's so stressful. I don't want to become a "bridezilla" because I can't handle stress. I wish we could just go back and say no, but I've already invited my out of town family, and they're super excited (and I'm actually really excited to see them too now), and they wont be able to come if we go back to our original plans, and I think his parents would take it personally and know it was coming from me (they already think I don't like them because I don't come with my partner when he visits them, but I do like them, I just have agoraphobia and leaving the house is painfully hard) My friends said I was in the right for setting boundaries but my partner thinks it was a little harsh and I should have just waited until he could talk to her (even though he hasn't spoken to her at all in the last 2 weeks since he flipped all our previous planning on it's head.) Do you think I was too harsh?

WRITING.TITLE: Random boob growth in mid 20s?
WRITING.TEXT: First, I haven't gained any weight, in fact I've lost an inch off my waist somehow, so it's not that. Just under a month ago, I had *really* bad breast tenderness. In general I don't get breast tenderness every period, maybe three or four times a year and it's usually just a little sore, but this was almost unbearable. they also felt heavier and denser than normal. Because of some other irregularities, I thought I might be pregnant, but it turned out I wasn't. My period came and my boobs just stopped hurting. But since then, while the band fits exactly the same, I'm literally spilling out of my bra. I only got it a few months ago and it fit perfect when I got it, so the difference is very obvious. I'm already a 38K, I don't think I can handle getting bigger. I'm not on hormonal birth control, and my diet and exercise levels haven't changed. Does anyone know what could have caused random growth? Or is this just something that happens in mid 20s? Do I need to worry about further growth?

WRITING.TITLE: Show me your aisle song
WRITING.TEXT: So, pretty much the only things that are set in stone right now are the rings, date and my aisle song. You know, the song I'll be walking down the aisle to. I didn't want the traditional wedding march, and being a gamer my entire life, I'm walking down the aisle to one of my favourite instrumental pieces from one of my favourite games. ["Build 4" from The Sims](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UbA58yOhPH4) I love it because even if you never played the game, it's still just a nice piano piece. To me, it sounds so hopeful. It means a lot to me (I spent many a year building my dream house and making my future family to this song), and honestly it was the first song I thought of when trying to decide. **I want to know what you guys are planning to walk to! Does it have sentimental value? Do you just like the song? Are you keeping it traditional and having the ever classic march?** It's a little embarrassing (and according to my FH "creepy") but when I'm wedding planning I've just got it on repeat in the back ground. It keeps me focused! ETA: Extra question from yeahyeahsuresuree: are you guys using the instrumental version of the songs or the version with lyrics?

WRITING.TITLE: Things I've learned about weddings from this sub about weddings.
WRITING.TEXT: Like the title says, here are some things I'd never heard of before coming to this sub. 1. Engagement photo shoots are a thing. 2. Brides maids proposal boxes. 3. That save the date cards aren't just another name for invitations, but actually separate cards entirely, that are sent before invitations. 4. Favours for the guests?? Most of my ignorance was because I've only ever been to one wedding, and it was a 2nd/3rd marriage between two over middle aged people, and they did everything super cheap and didn't bother with most traditions and stuff like that. So many things "outside" of the wedding that go into a wedding that I had no idea about! Who else learned things they didn't know from this sub? Or, on the flip side, what have you found yourself explaining to people about wedding planning and options that they had no idea about before? My FH had no idea wedding cupcakes were an option until we started talking about the cake!

WRITING.TITLE: Dress and breasts question
WRITING.TEXT: I'm a 38K, Built-in-bras are just not a thing for people at my size. In my mind I imagine having to wear my bra under my dress because I don't know how sturdy the bodice of a wedding dress is, so that means like 90% of dresses are off the table for me because they're either sleeveless/strapless or off the shoulder, or halterneck, and my bra straps will show. Normally I don't care about bra straps but this is a formal occasion, it's just not appropriate and I know I'd feel self conscious about it. Not to mention how uncomfortable it will be, my bra cuts in as it is and I can't wear it without pain for more than a few hours, i'm going to be in my dress at least 10 hours, with the dress adding pressure to that. My question is mainly directed at other brides who are both plus size and have boobs bigger than a G - Were you able to go braless with your dress? did you find the girls slipping down, falling out, or looking misshapen? This is the one thing that's been playing on my mind, because I'm not going to be able to dress shop for a few months yet, so I just want an idea of what do expect? are wedding dress bodices more like corsets? or so they just do that useless thing where they sew "cups" into the dress?

We have one frying pan and two saucepans, that's it. We have a bullet blender so getting the cauliflower into "rice form" will be fine, we just have no idea what to do with it after that. I'm kinda worried about boiling it, because i don't want it to get too soft. can we have it raw? will it even taste ok? I've never tasted it before so I don't know what to expect. WRITING.TITLE: Post Malogue
Anyone know a site i can hire a driver with a car to transport a mangy dog?
WRITING.TEXT: A family friend just died and left his elderly dog behind. After painful consideration we've decided it would be best to have her euthanized, as she's very old and sick herself, and we don't want to send her to a shelter just for her to die alone. Problem is, we don't have a car, or know anyone with a car who is willing to take her, and I don't blame them. She was poorly looked after and has flees, mites and god knows what else, and she's not house trained and likely to mess in the car, due the the stress and grief she is currently experiencing. She's too poorly to walk there, and too big to be carried. I've looked online and obviously most drivers for hire aren't equipped to take a dog like this, they can't afford to risk their car getting all smelly and flea'd up. If anyone knows a website or maybe a charity that can help me find a car (and a driver - none of us can drive so we can't just hire a car) that will take an animal, it would be amazing. In the bristol area, just from southmead to filton, and obviously, only a one way trip needed. **ETA**: Thank you so much for the suggestions, but I eventually found a pet taxi and they were brilliant and it wasn't very expensive. We were able to get her in tonight, save another night alone. She's gone now, but in the moment she was loved and she was comfortable on the journey there. **ETA2**: Because someone asked and incase anyone else was wondering, to save having the rifle through the comments, the pet taxi I used was was [Shaun's Doggy Day Care and Pet Care Services](http://shaunsdoggydaycareandpetcare.co.uk/).

WRITING.TITLE: Best community I #8217;ve experienced
WRITING.TEXT: For the longest time I played in pve servers but thought I #8217;d give pvp a go. I quickly figured out that it was easier to just not have doors, because building destruction time is when I #8217;m offline. Rather than give people a reason to smash my base up trying to get in, they can just come in and take what they want, so I go to bed, and hope I don #8217;t wake up naked in the desert. I thought that was going to be the norm, but it actually hasn #8217;t happened yet. I #8217;ve been playing for a couple of weeks now, without a clan, and some days I wake up and a some of my things are gone (like iron weapons, hardened stone, stuff like that) and others I wake up and everything but my clothes is gone, but so far, they have all left me alive, and they #8217;ve not smashed my base up at all. But what I really wanted to talk about, is how today I woke up, and instead of *missing* things, someone had given me stuff! They gave me a full set of high level armour, a weapon and a bunch of resources like iron and hardened stone, and a level 3 tanner! I went around my base, checking all my stations, it was like Christmas and I #8217;m not exaggeration when I say this, but I almost cried. It #8217;s so nice and so unexpected. I #8217;ve never experienced this level of generosity on any game I #8217;ve played before. For a game that is supposed to be dog eat dog, the community is so fair, it #8217;s really amazing. Thank you to those mystery gifters and in the future when I #8217;m max level, I #8217;ll pass it forward.

WRITING.TITLE: Top layers changed? This top used to layer on top of these jeans, why has it changed? Can I change it back?
A game like Love Nikki
WRITING.TEXT: I know this isn't *directly* related to Love Nikki, but I recently started playing a new phone game that i think many Love Nikki fans would love, if they're not already playing. It's called Royal Chaos. ^^^^^(it ^^^^has ^^^^a ^^^^subreddit ^^^^if ^^^^anyone ^^^^is ^^^^interested ^^^^r/royalchaos) It's like Love Nikki in some ways, different in others. Like Love Nikki, there is paid content but you can earn pay currency in-game at a slower rate. It's got the fashion aspect, there are outfits to craft and collect, but also some fighting (kind of, it auto attacks but you are responsible for recruiting, arranging, equipping and leveling your "team"), and other mini games, like romancing the emperor. Also you can play as male, or female! And i haven't tried it yet but I've heard you can have more than one character on different servers too. it was a little confusing to get into but you get used to it, and the tutorials are very helpful. If anyone here is a fan of the Chinese historical drama Empresses in the Palace, it reminds me very strongly of that. I had so much fun on it last night I nearly forgot to log into Love Nikki before bed for the first time since I started playing almost a year ago. I'm not trying to steal players from love nikki though, just be be clear - I just know i'd appreciate it if i didn't know about this game and someone from here introduced me. **Has anyone else got any suggestions for games that Love Nikki fans might enjoy**? Doesn't have to be a Love Nikki clone but just any games you play that have the same feel or aesthetics, or maybe similar mechanics.

Male Lineage
WRITING.TEXT: It's always disappointing when you die, and realise all your female babies died before adulthood but all your males made it to their 40's or old age, and even more disappointing when you're a male but none of your sisters made it to adulthood, effectively ending the line. I think it would be interesting, and give a new spin on being male, if when a female gives birth, the closest (maybe within 3 tiles either direction) unrelated male was the childs father, or better yet, if there were some kind of marriage system that meant all children after that were that mans child (like the naming system, but one person says "marry me" and the other unrelated, opposite sex person has to reply "i do" and now they're married - all children after that have the male listed as father and now they have 2 "eves" in their family tree. This will be interesting because now, males will have to make a choice - stay and help their birth family, or go and find an unrelated tribe once old enough to start their own family. (and like real life, males can father children from puberty to death by old age) It could also incentivise tribes in general to seek each other out and live together.

I don #8217;t want to be that person but; what #8217;s with the blatant sexism??
WRITING.TEXT: **Edit: It was a bug! After resetting the server it was fixed!** I #8217;m not going to delete this though, just incase it happens to someone else and they search it up. #8212; #8212; #8212; Me, husband, bro-in-law and another friend were all playing together in multiplayer, and they all had male avatars and I had a female avatar. We all tried logging and for some reason I couldn #8217;t pick up the logs - and no, it wasn #8217;t because they were too heavy - the others were able to pick up the same logs. At first I thought it was just a glitch, and my husband joked that it was because I was a girl avatar. I changed to a male avatar and was able to pick up logs - we thought that was funny, but mostly I thought #8220;maybe the glitch is fixed now because I logged out #8221; I changed back to a female avatar, and the problem returned. I couldn #8217;t even pick up tiny chunks. When I click pick up, it moves slightly and just drops. By this point I felt like that it was more than a coincidence. Curious if it was just me, my bro-in-law and our friend both logged out and came back as female avatars. Suddenly they were unable to lift logs either. One person is funny. 3 people is a pattern. This is untrue - a myth. The muscles behind your breasts are worked out the same way men #8217;s pecs are. They will atrophy if you don #8217;t use your arms/chest muscles. Your breasts will sit higher which will make them look perkier, but if they are past a certain size, bra, or lack of one, isn #8217;t going to make much difference at all, visually. What makes breast #8220;saggy #8221; is age, weight fluctuation, bodily changes after pregnancy, and just your natural breast shape - some women have naturally low nipple placement that make their breasts look saggy, some women fat distribution that makes them look like they hang lower. These things can #8217;t be helped. Bras do not do anything to breast shape. They are entirely make of fat and breast tissue. Someone with very strong chest muscles can have saggy breasts, and someone with atrophied chest muscles can have perky looking breasts. Again, bras have little to no impact on this.

**TL;DR: 14/15 with a 22 year old. Only broke up because he was was always talking down About himself which was emotionally exhausting.** I was 14, me and my friends made dating profiles on something like plenty of fish or something - this was before tinder. Obviously I had to say I was older and put that I was 19. (I know now that was a dick thing to do) The point of making the accounts was basically to practice flirting safely, but mostly so we could share the weird shit men said to us (secretly). The plan was never to actually build a relationship with any of these men - but I met a 22 year old guy who I *thought* was really nice, but in hindsight, he was actually just kind of pathetic, and being 14, I confused pity for affection. So at first it was very innocent, so I didn #8217;t feel too guilty about lying about my age, but then we got a little closer and I finally admitted I was 14 (I was nearly 15) and he was understandably upset. Now, if the story ended here, it would be a story about an asshole teen who catfished a lonely guy. But it doesn #8217;t end there. At first he said we should stop, but being a child who thought she was feeling love for the first time, I asked him to reconsider. I said something like #8220;you believed I was 19, so obviously I #8217;m mature for my age, and it #8217;s my birthday soon! #8221; And he agreed to continue our relationship. Age of consent is 16 here and we agreed that he would wait for me. He should have just said no and if I persisted, blocked me. I would have HATED him at the time, but I would have understood by the time I was his age. Our relationship remained online. We didn #8217;t live far from each other and were planning to meet, but (luckily) things kept coming up. Things obviously turned sexual over time. I didn #8217;t have a webcam and this was before smart phones so luckily I never ended up sending nude photos or videos or anything, but he masturbated on camera at least once. It didn #8217;t creep me out at the time, I enjoyed it because I wasn #8217;t aware of the context of it all. We spoke to each other very explicitly and we spoke on the phone a few times (couldn #8217;t do that often because adults were around and might hear) As I mentioned before he was kinda pathetic. He was one of those guys who would put himself down so that I would be like #8220;aww, no, you #8217;re not those things, you #8217;re great, and I love you! #8221; And I didn #8217;t realise how emotionally draining it was at first, to constantly be boosting his ego. Then some shit went down in my home (you didn #8217;t think a teen girl dating an adult man came from a stable home, did you?) and I went to go live with my dad (who I had literally just spent time with for the first time since I was 9). This put me even further away. It was around this time, after about 5 months of being together, that I started to notice how draining being with him was. I still cared about him but I was getting frustrated with his constant self deprecation. My heart would drop when I saw he was online because I knew it was either just going to be depressing or horny -usually both. I didn #8217;t mind horny, but not when I knew it was just going to end with me talking him up again. Also he had lied about something kind of small but when I caught him out he got defensive and that really just put a bad taste in my moth about everything he #8217;d told me. I also had depression at the time and it was really impacting me. Beyond this, my friends implied that a boy from school, a boy I had a crush on for years, might like me Not even confirmation, just that he *might* like me. I had already become friendly with him since moving (I got everyone #8217;s details before moving schools) So I took this as my out. Before I made any move on this other boy, I told my boyfriend that I didn #8217;t want to be with him anymore. I can #8217;t remember exactly how the conversation went but I know I blamed him always being negative and making me feel bad, I remember saying like word for word #8220;I #8217;m 15 years old! I shouldn #8217;t have to deal with this! #8221; And he asked me if there was someone else and I didn #8217;t want to lie so I was upfront about the fact that I was planning to try things with a boy my own age. We argued and the last thing he said was #8220;don #8217;t message me again unless you #8217;re single #8221;. Then he blocked me. (I #8217;m married to the other boy now) But yeah. I #8217;m just really lucky we never met up because just before I moved (which was very spur of the moment, I literally had an argument and was gone the next day) we were finally planning to meet properly, like we had a date and everything, and we were 100% planning to have sex. At the time I thought it was great and I felt so adult. By the time I was 22 I realised how gross it was. It #8217;s fucked up to me that I only broke up with him because he was depressing, and not because he was a 22 year old going out with 15 year old. Ew.

#8220;[blue eyes, brown eyes](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jane_Elliott) #8221; A summary: gt;Elliott divided her class by eye color #8212; those with blue eyes and those with brown. On the first day, the blue-eyed children were told they were smarter, nicer, neater, and better than those with brown eyes. Throughout the day, Elliott praised them and allowed them privileges such as a taking a longer recess and being first in the lunch line. In contrast, the brown-eyed children had to wear collars around their necks and their behavior and performance were criticized and ridiculed by Elliott. On the second day, the roles were reversed and the blue-eyed children were made to feel inferior while the brown eyes were designated the dominant group. gt;What happened over the course of the unique two-day exercise astonished both students and teacher. On both days, children who were designated as inferior took on the look and behavior of genuinely inferior students, performing poorly on tests and other work. In contrast, the #8220;superior #8221; students #8212; students who had been sweet and tolerant before the exercise #8212; became mean-spirited and seemed to like discriminating against the #8220;inferior #8221; group. gt; #8220;I watched what had been marvelous, cooperative, wonderful, thoughtful children turn into nasty, vicious, discriminating little third-graders in a space of fifteen minutes, #8221; says Elliott. She says she realized then that she had #8220;created a microcosm of society in a third-grade classroom. #8221;

My name is weird, I #8217;m painfully white and my name sounds pretty foreign, which sounds like it would be cool because it makes me seem #8220;unique #8221; but it really just isn #8217;t. First, no one knows how to spell it - it #8217;s not even like, weirdly lettered, it #8217;s spelled how it sounds, but people always overestimate and add loads of unnecessary letters or even just put in letters that are obviously not in there?? It #8217;s weird. Also, while most people can say it, a lot of people get it wrong when reading it - even though, again, it #8217;s spelled how it sounds. Lastly, my name was never on any of those dumb key rings at tourist places and stuff. Sounds stupid but as a kid it always just hurt, when everyone else was going through them and finding their names and I was just like... there #8217;s no point. There was a time when I was very young that i would still look and hope. One time my sister (who has an equally #8220;unique #8221; name) actually found one with her name on it and we freaked out, but obviously couldn #8217;t find one for me... Another weird thing is I hate hearing people say my name to me. Like if they just say it randomly in conversation it just makes me feel really uncomfortable and like they #8217;re talking down to me? I only like it when people I know say my full name, I prefer strangers to use the shorter version. I always say when I meet people #8220;my name is [name], but [short name] is easier #8221; so I don #8217;t have to listen to them struggle say my name back to me correctly after literally just hearing me say it.

Omg literally this week the craziest thing~ So, my mum calls me and says she wants to hang out because she hasn #8217;t seen me in ages, and she calls my sister (because she has a car) to hang out too. My sister turns up, and tells me and my husband that my cousin (who I #8217;m not super close to, but my sister is) had messaged her with this story. This woman had been messaging my cousin #8217;s fianc #233;s mum and other family members, asking questions about this man in their family. The man in question was estranged so it was very weird for this person to be asking questions and having certain knowledge. So my cousin went snooping on this woman #8217;s Facebook, and saw she had friends in common. That friend being me, and my husband. My sister just happened to be seeing our cousin that day, so we went to see her where she told me the rest. She said she couldn #8217;t believe it when she saw the pictures of me on this strangers profile, it was so surreal. She sent me screenshots of the conversations. This person, was my *mother in law*. My very *married* mother in law. In the first set of questions she said she was seeing the man she was asking questions about, but in later conversations with someone else she said this man was seeing her daughter and she was worried that this man was lying about who he is. Either way, my cousin and her family read this as my mother in law cheating on her husband (they saw she was married on her profile) and trying to find out more information about this male relative. My cousin was worried about telling me but knew she had to. I forwarded the screenshots to my husband and we talked about them, and what i noticed about them, is they did *not* look like they were written by my mother in law. She writes borderline incoherently. Lots of pauses, missing words and unnecessary punctuation. Where as these messages, while sometimes a little odd, were mostly written properly. Another red flag was that when she was called out as being a related to my cousin through me, she named my mum by her Facebook name, which is different to her real name and it #8217;s obvious this person just checked Facebook to see her name, but my mother in law 100% knows my mums name and would have called her so. The final sign that it wasn #8217;t her, was that she referred to her sons as #8220;step sons #8221; - this seemed like a huge slip. I thought it was her husband, who is controlling, possessive, and paranoid about her cheating. He is much better with phones and tech in general than she is, and it seems he has been using her account and then deleting the messages. She found out later it was him because she took the phone to a police friend who checked it for her, and they #8217;re still looking into it. So basically my mother in law was (seemingly) cheating with my cousin #8217;s fianc #233;s uncle (i think? It was confusing), but then it turned out it was her jealous husband posing as her because last time they went clubbing his guy touched her thigh. It #8217;s like one of those convoluted tv comedy dramas. Literally what are the chances?? We don #8217;t even all live in the same towns. (For those worried about her situation, she is considering leaving him after this, and has a lot of support and family she can stay with if she needs to leave quickly. She #8217;ll be ok.)

Forget he's your boyfriend for a moment. Now, if some boy was treating you like this, would that make you think "wow, i'd sure like to be in a relationship with him!" If your answer is no, maybe think about why you \*are\* in a relationship with him. It's one thing to poke fun at each other but he knows this is upsetting you and yet he continues. Not every relationship is supposed to last forever, maybe this is the wake up call that you've outgrown him. People change, and obviously he can't handle that. If the only things keeping you with him are 1) the time you've already spent together (don't waste more time you could be spending on yourself or someone else) and 2) he's nice sometimes (lots of guys are nice \*all\* of the time, don't settle) - you deserve better reasons.

**TL;DR: a guy at GameStation gave me something for free so I could play an old PS1 game when I was a teenager.** When I was a kid I had a copy version of this game, Rhapsody: A Musical Adventure on PS1, it was my favourite game ever, I played it for literally months until I got stuck. my evil step cousin snapped the disc, and I was never able to finish the game. When I was a teenager, I realised I could buy a real version of the game. But I couldn #8217;t find a PAL version! So I had to order the NTSC version. But I couldn #8217;t get it to play. I thought using the cheat/copy disc would make it work (I #8217;d read online it would) So on a whim, I went to a GameStation and told the guy behind the counter my problem. I knew it was a stretch, but it paid off! The guy was super sympathetic and told me to buy a PS1 with a slot in the back for a cheat cartridge (mine didn #8217;t have the slot) and then come back, and he would *see if* he could find his old cheat cartridge. I left feeling ecstatic - I #8217;m getting *so close*! Bought the PS1 with the slot, and came back a few days later. Again I wasn #8217;t holding out hope that he had it but it was nice enough that he even offered. But he had it!!! I was like #8220;how much? #8221; Expecting him to charge me because he went through all that effort - which I was fine with! But he was just like #8220;nah, you can have it, at least it #8217;s getting used now #8221; and I was like omg thank you so much! Got home, it worked, and over the next few weeks i completed my favourite game. All thanks to that guy!

You can #8217;t make the right choice if you don #8217;t have all the information. #8220;Don #8217;t do it or you #8217;ll die #8221; is less than no information, it #8217;s misinformation. Sex Ed is the only way to protect children from themselves, each other, and predators. Parents are supposed to look after their kids but the sad fact is many children come from abusive or neglectful homes and their parents cannot be trusted. Schools and public education are meant to be #8220;the great equaliser #8221; (even if we know that #8217;s not true in practice) but how can children be equal when some of them have access to information and facts about their bodies and reproductive rights, and others do not by no fault of their own. Especially for young girls. An unwanted pregnancy could derail her life the way it might not for a boy in the same situation. Adult men are always looking for vulnerable and uneducated girls to groom and rape - those experiences can cause life long psychological damage. Sex education isn #8217;t just to make sure kids know how to have sex. It #8217;s to help them understand why they should and shouldn #8217;t make certain choices. I also believe relationships should be part of sex education. Things like consent, red flags, manipulation, abuse - all these things should be talked about with children BEFORE they start having sexual relationships.

WRITING.TITLE: UK tenant: Who is responsible to pay in this situation?
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m a tenant, and have been living here for over 5 years and the shower in the bath has been here longer than we have. It #8217;s the kind where the two taps are combined into one, with a shower hose in the middle and one leaver that controls the temperature (left and right) and pressure (basically just on and off though) with a little pull stop that changes the water from coming out the tap to going through the shower. The whole thing is metal except the bit inside, which is this weird rubbery plastic. Through what I believe to be normal wear and tear, today the handle just snapped off as I was getting out of the shower. I was trying to turn it off but it snapped before the water stopped. This meant there was no way to turn the water off, as neither faucet has it #8217;s own tap, and the only way to get it to stop was to turn off the water mains. (If there is a point where we can turn off just the bath, we couldn #8217;t find it. And we *really* looked.) Obviously we called the landlord because we are now without water, and he quickly informed us that we would be responsible to pay for repairs. He claims it comes under accidental damage. Neither of us think this is right, as it wasn #8217;t an accident, it was something that would have happened eventually, and obviously it #8217;s something that wouldn #8217;t have happened if he had maybe replaced it before it got to this point. My point being, this, to me, seems more just a case of normal wear and tear, just like when the boiler breaks, we don #8217;t have to pay for it because he is responsible for it, it #8217;s his house and he is responsible for maintaining it. I would understand if we had just moved in and were extra rough with it, but this is not the case. We #8217;ve never caused trouble. But I know I can say all this and the law might see it differently. I would just like to know, legally, where we stand if he tries to get us to foot the bill. I think just the shower and taps needs replacing (so not like we need a full plumber visit) and shouldn #8217;t cost much but it #8217;s still more than we have. For reference, we are in a flat (house converted into 4 flats) and low income, though not on benefits. We are in England.

I checked my tenancy agreement and the most relevant section, under #8220;tenant #8217;s obligations #8221;, #8220;general liabilities, services and utilities #8221; Part 2.4: #8220;to be held liable for the fair net costs involved in carrying out repair and maintenance to the premises or its fixtures or fittings where such action is required **as a result of negligence**, or significant breach of this agreement, **or mis-use, by the tenant or his invited guests or visitors.** #8221; I emphasised those points because I don #8217;t believe they apply to us? If there was negligence, it #8217;s on his part, surely? And we definitely didn #8217;t misuse the tap or it wouldn #8217;t have lasted the 5 years plus however many before we moved here.
Thank you, I did after posting (I got a message suggesting it after posting) But thought I would leave it here just incase

As far as I can find, the only other section related to the landlord and his liabilities regarding fixtures is the thing that you mentioned before (section 11) that excludes fixtures. So I don #8217;t know what that means? It doesn #8217;t say explicitly either way, from what I can gather?

Don #8217;t apologise, you #8217;ve been massively helpful! Obviously I #8217;d rather hear that we #8217;re not responsible but the goal was just finding out if we have a leg to stand on. Sounds like that #8217;s not the case, but at least we know now! We can focus on *how* we #8217;re going to pay rather than *if*.

Yeah, it #8217;s like one single tap/leaver in the middle that controls both hot and cold, on and off. The whole top bit that you move just snapped off. Yes, we need the tap to use the shower/bath, as it #8217;s the only way to control the water. Right now it #8217;s stuck in #8220;on #8221; mode, and we found that it doesn #8217;t have its own pressure valve, so to turn it off, we have to turn off ALL the water. It #8217;s basically a choice between leaving the water running (which is wasteful and expensive) or not having any water at all, no sink, no washing machine - no toilet. The water valve is in an extremely awkward place and it #8217;s a huge hassle to turn it on and off, but our plan is it turn it on for short periods to do essential things like flush the toilet or wash dishes. I will keep this in mind for when the landlord brings it up again.

VPN isn #8217;t just to do illegal stuff, it #8217;s just general internet security. The way you buy anti-virus software for your computer, you should also think about a VPN. Being able to watch foreign Netflix is just a bonus.

Because those #8220;watch it free #8221; websites are constantly changing address and sometimes fake versions pop up that are literally just there to give you viruses. Even on the real version, there is risk of viruses. It takes forever to download an episode of something (for us at least) where as Netflix just plays as soon as you put it on. You don #8217;t have to search for a good quality version with netflix, while you might have to click 3 or 4 links before you find a good quality version on one of those websites. As someone else mentioned - subtitles. I need them because though I #8217;m not deaf, I have a form of deafness where I can #8217;t differentiate foreground sound like speech with background noise very well and miss dialogue if there #8217;s no subtitles. Not every one of these websites has them and I #8217;m not going to go and download them separately. When your browsing Netflix, it suggests stuff to you based on your watching history, so you find stuff you might not otherwise have seen. That doesn #8217;t happen on random websites. And a big one is that I mostly use my PS4 to watch tv. I #8217;ve tried using those free sites to watch old cartoons but the browser just doesn #8217;t have enough space. But it can run Netflix and other streaming services. Basically, you #8217;re paying for convenience and safety. We #8217;re pretty poor but even for us the cost of like, #163;7 a month is worth it. We know every time that a movie we pick is going to be good quality, not going to give us a virus, will have subtitles and is likely something we #8217;ll enjoy. No pissassing about on suspicious websites putting my PC at risk.

I didn #8217;t misread your comment, when I said #8220;you #8221; about not being about to control your mouth that was more a general #8220;you #8221; as in, anyone who might be reading who has problems controlling their mouths. Not targeted at you, I know it wasn #8217;t you who got banned for being rude. I acknowledged your situation in an edit, but that doesn #8217;t change that it #8217;s a completely different situation. Identity theft happens in other aspects of life too, and has unfair consequences for the victims - that #8217;s not something unique to game platforms, and again, is its own separate issue, Which you pointed out can be fixed. When someone chooses to break the rules they get banned and they deserve it, regardless of how much money they spent. The fact that your friend just made another account also has nothing to do with the point. You were saying in your original post that it #8217;s #8220;not fair #8221; because your friend #8220;got mad and said some stuff #8221; and lost his account. You played it down, as though he didn #8217;t deserve to be banned, now you #8217;re saying he goes out of he way to be a cunt, to the point where he has a whole new account *just be be a cunt* so he #8217;s not worried about being banned, but somehow he can keep his cool on his account he spends money on. So your point about people #8220;just losing their temper #8221; really has no leg to stand on, because your own example is proof that your friend is just a prick who knows better and was just stupid enough to be a prick on his main account, and got in trouble for it. As for the driving example, again, not a good analogy because when people can #8217;t drive they can lose their job, home, everything. When you lose a gaming account, you only lose what money you #8217;ve already spent - which sucks but it #8217;s not going to impact the path of your immediate financial future. You haven #8217;t lost the ability to make more money when your PSN account is shut down (unless you #8217;re like a streamer or you tuber but in that case you should be more careful, like any employee is careful not to lose their job) There are no laws about not being an asshole driver unless your being like, actually dangerous. Online games DO have rules about being assholes because the owners of the game will lose money if no one wants to play their game because of other players. And yeah, people get angry sometimes, but feelings and actions are separate, and while people are entitled to feel however they feel, the second they act on it in a way that is detrimental to other people, they are 100% responsible for those actions. Screaming at people is an action. Everyone gets angry but most adults or even late teens can control themselves enough not to react like a child, and if they can #8217;t... they have to be willing to either take responsibility for the consequences, or learn to be better. And then there are people like your friend who isn #8217;t #8220;just getting angry #8221; but actively choosing to just be a bastard. I get what you #8217;re saying, I understand the fears but also everything was new once, and we made rules for them. Using cars as example again, they were new and unregulated once, but now you need a licence, we have roads and road laws, and in most places the government is responsible for making sure there are safe, usable roads. We have the internet now. People will complain and organise and boycott services that take advantage. But things like PayPal just ending and people losing their money - again, that already happens with banks. These aren #8217;t new problems, they #8217;re just packaged in a new way, and we either already have ways of dealing with it or there is no way for us to deal with it in our current system and it #8217;s just a risk we take. Even when it comes to game services shutting down and losing all those games - similar things have already happened. Old games servers go offline - for primarily online games, that means you can #8217;t use it anymore. You paid for the game but sorry, they don #8217;t support it anymore. My husband had a bunch of digital comics on his PSP and the service was shut down and he lost them all. It sucks but what could he do? If you are worried about losing games, for now at least, buy physical copies. Everytime we spend money online is a risk, and that risk is compounded when you are buying something that you can #8217;t hold. It #8217;s scary but we accept those risks.

It #8217;s because it presents different in men and women. Women only really get diagnosed if they have other developmental disorders that are common with autism, but if you #8217;re someone with high functioning autism - fuck you, you #8217;re on your own. Where I live they still diagnose women based on the male criteria. I had been researching how autism affects women for years before I tried to get a diagnosis and I hit just about every single common trait, including sensory issues that have impacted my life in very serious ways. After my assessment they said I had #8220;autistic tendencies #8221; whatever the fuck that means, and they think some of the more prevalent symptoms I have could have been explained by childhood trauma... like I can #8217;t have childhood trauma *and* be autistic?? It was so stupid. Like I have this laundry list of mental and physical health problems that they are saying are all separate, that could be explained by autism. But I guess I didn #8217;t like trains enough?? The don #8217;t take into consideration the biological differences but also just the societal differences that lead to it presenting less obviously in women. Girls are socialised more than boys, so girls on the higher end of the spectrum are able to blend in better. Not always perfectly but usually enough to get by. Our interests are usually shaped by what is #8220;acceptable #8221; for little girls to be into. Little boys can love trains and planes, but little girls are pushed towards animals and people, dolls and teddys. So maybe I don #8217;t have a collection of mint condition baseball cards. But I did have many digital collections online. Neopets, dragon cave creature breeder, felisfire, lioden... I don #8217;t even need to mention my obsession with collecting every coin, jewel, star, ring that was counted towards 100% completion on computer games. But all that isn #8217;t *obvious*. And after 23 years of trying to blend in - still always having the reputation of being a bit weird - I am able to hold a conversation, and I am eloquent. *Because I practiced.* I made the conscious effort to know big words, and how to use them in conversation, and I would think up analogies to explain myself in my spare time, so when I had to (because I always fucking had to) it was less confusing for people. Maybe it seemed effortless, but it was *very* deliberate, and was not always the case for me. Summery: getting diagnosed for autism when you #8217;re woman with no other developmental challenges in the UK fucking sucks. /rant

Not me but my aunt. She was dating this guy who seemed perfect. Bought her flowers, wrote her poems, wanted to spend all his time with her - all the stuff she considered #8220;gentlemanly #8221;. He came to Christmas dinner one year and after they left EVERYONE agreed that he gave of a really weird #8220;off #8221; vibe, even though he was perfectly polite. Half a year later around my aunts birthday, she invited me and my mum to the pub by her house (I was only like 15 at the time) and they were doing karaoke and stuff. Her boyfriend kept calling her asking her to come home but she was like #8220;no, I #8217;ll come home later, I #8217;m spending some girl time with my family #8221; and he got so mad that he came to the pub and made her leave, so we all went home too. Later that night, my nan (who I lived with) got a phone call at like 3AM from the police saying my aunt was in hospital - this guy had tried to kill her. Literally he was strangling her to death when the police busted in and pulled him off her. After that, it all came out that when he wasn #8217;t seeing my aunt, he was working as a male prostitute, and he was wanted for raping a teen boy. She had no idea about any of it, and before that night he had barely even raised his voice at her, let alone hurt her. It happened so long ago that he #8217;s out of prison now. My aunt is still suffering with the emotional and physical ramifications of that night.

WRITING.TITLE: The grasshoppers message for me
WRITING.TEXT: Last few days I #8217;ve been noticing a lot of grasshoppers trying to get into my house. Obviously grasshoppers are always around in summer but not usually like this. Not usually in my house. Sometimes I google long questions not expecting a real answer, but to just see what comes up, so on a whim I googled #8220;why are grasshoppers trying to get into my house #8221; And the result that caught my eye was #8220;When a grasshopper is trying to tell you something #8221; It was mostly just a cute story of a woman finding a grasshopper in a supermarket but at the bottom it had quoted a section from a wiki on the spiritual significance of grasshoppers, and one part in particular stood out to me: #8220;*Grasshoppers can only jump forward #8230;.not backward, or sideways. So, when grasshopper shows up he could be reaffirming to you that you are taking the right steps to move forward in your current situation.* #8221; And it just made me really happy. I #8217;m agoraphobic, and have been for many years. But in the last 8 months I #8217;ve finally been getting help. Things have been going really well and while I #8217;m a long way off from being an independent functional adult, just the fact that I #8217;m still making progress after 8 months is monumental to me. I #8217;ve tried to get help in the past but always stop as soon as the first obstacle came along. Not this time. I #8217;ve had obstacles and pushed through. I don #8217;t really believe in signs, but just reading that made me feel good. It #8217;s interesting and kinda funny to me. But I thought you guys would appreciate it. I am the grasshopper right now, and I need to keep jumping forward.

Getting a taxi, though cheap, was a big expense for us that felt like a luxury. Not everyone lives the same life as you or has the same options you do. Being poor doesn #8217;t make you a bad person. Real fuckin stressed. My husband and I are going to try to foster my nephew. It #8217;s us, or he goes into the system and obviously none of us want that to happen. We don #8217;t have kids, so that #8217;s a whole new world we #8217;re jumping straight into. And if we #8217;re approved we #8217;ll have to move, which is REALLY stressing me out. But the thing that #8217;s really getting to me is the waiting around for the next step. His social worker has implied that things look positive and they are going to try and push for his placement with us, but she is also taking her time to get back to me. Waiting around for more solid information is fucking painful. I just want to know - should I be looking for a new place? What kind of financial aid will we be entitled to? How long do we have to get a new place? Will he have to come and live with us in our tiny one bed until we can get a new place? So many questions that I need answers for. I #8217;m sitting around here, just not knowing and not being able to MAKE anything happen. No one to call, nothing to plan. I #8217;ve been keeping myself busy by getting a head start on packing - not fully, but organising and throwing out things that we don #8217;t need so we have less to move. Accidentally killed the spider that was taking care of our woodlice problem. AND on top of all of that, I #8217;m still fucking agoraphobic. I #8217;ve been getting help, things have been better than they have been in years, so this has come at sort of the perfect time, but also the worst time - I don #8217;t know if this will be *good* for my recovery, because it #8217;s giving me more of a reason to get out of the house and the motivation to push through, or if it #8217;s going to *hurt* my recovery. I don #8217;t know if it will be too much, too fast. Right now I feel ok about out it, but right now I only have myself to look after and my husband also looks after me a lot too. But now, if this goes through, I will be responsible for another person for the majority of the day. My husband works, so the majority of the parenting is going to fall to me and I #8217;m fine with that division of labour, I just hope I can actually do it - more importantly, I hope I can do it *well*. I #8217;m just scared and frustrated. But I don #8217;t want to talk to my family about it because I think they already have their doubts that we #8217;ll be able to handle him. But I #8217;m not going to let him go into care without a fight.

For some people - Get help for your depression. Maybe you don #8217;t think you #8217;re depressed, but if you consistently find it hard to do even basic household tasks, or stick to deadlines, you could be depressed. Even if you don #8217;t feel #8220;sad #8221;, you could still be depressed. For a long time I knew I was depressed (diagnosed) but just didn #8217;t seek help for it because I thought #8220;what #8217;s the point? Nothing will change #8221; and of course, that was the depression talking. I #8217;ve recently started taking anti-depressants. I #8217;ve taken different kinds in the past and they never worked. This time it #8217;s been like a giant hand has come into my life and picked me up, and has been pushing me forward. I literally do not remember a time in my life from before my depression where I felt this motivated, and I still have low motivation - it #8217;s just higher than it was. If you #8217;re able, try anti-depressants. And don #8217;t just stick with the first one if it doesn #8217;t feel like it #8217;s helping, and don #8217;t just decide that none of them work because the ones you tried haven #8217;t. I feel like I wasted my youth waiting to just magically get better. If it hasn #8217;t happened yet, it won #8217;t ever happen. Don #8217;t waste a decade like me. Get help, if you can.

I got two ways, one is more greasy than the other. Greasy way first because it takes less time: Get your frying pan, heat it up. I usually leave it at lowest heat which on my cooker is just hot enough to make water boil if you leave it long enough. I don #8217;t know how hot it actually is because it doesn #8217;t have any numbers on it. Butter one side of your bread, put bread in the hot pan. Put the cheese on the bread in the pan. I use mixed grated Cheddar and Red Leicester cheese but slices are probably fine too. Check the bottom every now and then and when it #8217;s dark (or however you like it) put the other piece of bread on top, and make sure it #8217;s buttered but the butter is on the outside. Use a spatula to press it down so the cheese stays steady, then use the spatula to flip the toasty. The cheese will likely not be fully melted yet. It will likely land a little wonky so use the spatula to push the top bread until it #8217;s straight, then just keep checking it until that side is done too. By now cheese should be fully melted. Done. Second way under the grill (I think Americans call it the broiler?). Put one piece of bread in for about 5 mins, don #8217;t flip it! When it #8217;s as dark as you like it, take it out, and on the untoastesd side put your cheese. Put back under the grill until either the cheese is mostly melted OR the corners start to get too dark - whichever is first. Then put a normal piece of bread on top, press it down, not too hard, then leave under the grill until it #8217;s as dark as you like it. Done. Takes longer but I like it better because it #8217;s not as greasy.

A couple of times. When I was very small, I went to a friends house - they lived just around the corner. I asked my mum if I could go. I had to wake her up and she said yes. She was asleep because she had just smoked heroin. When she woke up, she didn #8217;t remember and freaked out because I was missing. When I came back just as it was getting dark, my mum slapped me across the face. When I was a lot older, early teens, I went shopping with my nan. This was before teens having their own mobiles was common. My purse was in her bag. She wanted to go into one shop, so I said I #8217;d wait for her in Game. She took a really long time so I went to the shop and waited outside, but turns out I had just missed her and she was already off to Game to pick me up. I had no way to get home because my nan has my money, and no phone to call for help. So I went to the police station and they drove me home in a riot van. They said it was all they had but I think they were just trying to be fun. Turns out my nan had headed home to report me missing. Then again when I was a bit older, still early-mid teens, at the end of a school day one of my friends wanted to run away so I went with her. We walked for ages and were gone until it was dark but this nice couple at the farm house we stopped at (to ask for some water - it was summer and we had no money or anything) convinced us to call home. Those are all the times my family called the police to report me missing.

Because adoption is so easy? And to reply to your edit: My husband and I both consider us a couple. He #8217;s not #8220;nothing #8221; to me, he is everything to me. Which is exactly why I want more of him I #8217;m my life. Having a child that is part him is important to me - that doesn #8217;t necessarily mean bio kids, but a child we #8217;ve raised from birth so I can see my husbands influence in them - the way they talk, their mannerisms, their morality. But unfortunately, adopting a newborn baby is hard. We would be able to look after a baby but compared to other parents looking to adopt, we would be near the bottom of the list. Our most *realistic* chance at having a baby is to birth one. I #8217;ve been with my husband since we were both 15. We #8217;ve been talking about what we #8217;ll do with our future kids for over a decade. Some people want to be doctors, others want to be actors - our dream is to be parents. Just because it #8217;s something other people take for granted, or because it #8217;s not something you personally see as worthy, that doesn #8217;t mean it #8217;s a bad dream. We #8217;re happy together, but we #8217;ve had almost 13 years to enjoy each other alone. We #8217;re both ready to turn this couple, into a family.

The weirdest realisation of my life was that my mother, who did not raise me but was always around, knew me better than most other people in my life. The people who raised me did not know me at all. Like in the OP, they only knew what I showed them. I was almost an adult before I realised that my mum was the only person who consistently took my mental health issues seriously - even before I did, and knew how certain things would affect me before I had experienced them. I have other people who know me that deeply - my two best friends and my husband - but for better or worse, my mum understands me in a way that only someone with the same personality can, and she always tells me I #8217;m the only person she can talk to as well. Our relationship has had ups, and very big downs, but I always know she understands. And realising that was almost scary. Until then I felt my true self was only for me. No one else could see. But she saw me - she always did. And I realised I could see her. We see the world through the same lense, though we react to what we see very differently.

I think a lot of people who win a lot are people who have a lot of time to sit and play, practice and get better - or even just play so much that it #8217;s inevitable that they will win occasionally. They don #8217;t consider that a lot of people don #8217;t have the ability to put that much time into the game, and it #8217;s not fair to penalise them for this. As other people have already pointed out - this is a *casual* game. There are no scoreboards or ranks. Your win rate is personal. People say having 5 crown skins shows other people you #8217;re skilled - but it really doesn #8217;t. You get 3 free crowns and if you play long enough most players, even people who don #8217;t have a lot of time, will get 2 wins. They buy one 5 crown skin and now everyone thinks they #8217;re very skilled players. There is no way to determine whether someone has 5 wins or 15 wins on sight. So winning is really a personal achievement. Some people need to get wins to feel like they achieved something, but some people just want to enjoy the game, and wear skins they like. Getting crowns is getting harder and harder as people get better at the game. People who don #8217;t have the time to put into it will never catch up, and that is extremely demoralising. This would be reasonable for a competitive game, but not a game like fall guys. I say this as someone with a lot of time and a fair amount of wins - I #8217;m not arguing for myself, I just want other players to be able to get the same enjoyment out of this game as I do. I have friends who don #8217;t like playing anymore because they don #8217;t have time to get better and feel like they #8217;re getting no payout for their time spent. Time is expensive - why would they waste it on this game when they #8217;re not seeing any return? The whole point of the game is basically #8220;collect cosmetics #8221;. People are going to stop playing if they don #8217;t have access to half the interesting cosmetics. Awarding consistent play is the only way to guarantee the game doesn #8217;t die. Yes they have kudos, but you can buy kudos, so for people who have money but not time, it would be easier to buy kudos than earn them - this would take the fun out of playing. A way to slowly earn crows would, as other people have said #8220;meet both sides Half way #8221; winning would still mean skilled players can get 10 crown costumes as soon as they come out, but other players have to save up slowly and maybe eventually will be able to afford half the costume before the shop resets. I just thought of an idea to maybe limit the amount of silver crowns a person can earn in a day - that way people who have a lot of free time but not much skill can #8217;t earn too much without winning. Maybe a bar that only fills when you get to the finals, and once it #8217;s maxed out you don #8217;t get anymore points, but when the shop resets if the bar was full, gives you one crown. If it #8217;s not full, you just carry on filling it. That way you can get up to one crown a day, as long as you play enough and get to the finals, but not a guaranteed crown every day. They will have to determine how much experience each final should give so as to make it reasonably challenging for the majority of players, I #8217;ll leave that maths to them.

gt; not wealth or **time** I disagree. When I see someone with expensive crown skins, I assume they #8217;re someone who has a lot of free time, and some skill. WRITING.TITLE: Proposal to hopefully appease both sides of the #8220;participation award #8221; debate
WRITING.TEXT: As the devs said in their response to an earlier thread about silver crowns, there are two issues; 1. People with little time or ability (casual and new gamers) wanting a way to slowly earn crowns - being awarded for dedication. 2. People not wanting their achievements diminished by people being able to access crowns without winning. I think I might have a solution. It takes 35,000 EXP points to get to level 40. In that time everyone can earn 3 crowns, the last one at 17,000 EXP. I propose that once a person reaches level 40, though you stop levelling, you should continue to get EXP, and the bar fills up to 10,000 EXP. **For every 10,000 EXP you earn after level 40, you get a crown.** It takes days of normal play to get that much EXP. More than enough to make it feel like a challenge. No need for fragments or silver crowns - just experience. I know for me personally, as someone who is level 40, sometimes it feels kind of pointless to play because I feel I have nothing to work towards. Yes, I can earn kudos or maybe get a few crowns, but it #8217;s just not as enjoyable. For people who want something exclusive for their wins - **Unlockable exclusive colour variants.** In the wardrobe, for every win you get, you gain a Golden Kudo token Considering there is already colour variants of some costumes, maybe they could be combined in one thumbnail, and when you select it another window opens with all the colour variants you own, and shows the exclusive ones you can buy. (This would also help clean up the wardrobe, as it #8217;s getting pretty cluttered already with doubles of each costume) Some colour variants should still be sold for kudos or crowns, but the fact that some will only be available to people who have won will hopefully make them feel that sense of achievement. And you shouldn #8217;t be able to buy the unlockable colour variants of outfits until you own at least one version of it. That means you #8217;d still need to earn 10 crowns before being able to even unlock the exclusive versions of 10 crown skins, but it also means you can get fancy versions of cheap outfits too. Ten wins means 10 crowns, you only need two for one full outfit. This also makes it a little easier for the devs to add more content without having to create more unique meshes. I #8217;d love to hear what other people think?

Because they are not biological and don #8217;t have more than one gender, there is no male or female, they are just gems. You can #8217;t even really call them asexual (in the reproduction sense, not the orientation sense) because besides Rose, they don #8217;t reproduce. They technically don #8217;t have a sex, and so #8220;non binary #8221; is the best description. But they look and act as what we recognise as #8220;feminine #8221; so that became their #8220;default gender #8221; in our language, so they use she/her pronouns

I know but they are aliens that don #8217;t have a sex, so it makes sense that they only have one kind of gender expression. While gender and sex are different, gender doesn #8217;t exist without sex - gender is a social construct informed by our reproductive roles (with a ton of cultural shit piled on top). A race that doesn #8217;t have sex wouldn #8217;t have any reason to have gender, and the closest thing we have to that is #8220;non binary #8221;.

Yes, they are. They are both *no gender*. #8220;Masculine #8221; and #8220;feminine #8221; gender expressions only make sense when there are males and females. Even in the human non-binary spectrum, there are still only essentially 4 defined points - male, female, neither or both. Non binary genders are still heavily tied to the concept of masculinity and femininity - two things that only exist because we have two sexes. Again, a race that doesn #8217;t have even ONE sex can have no concept of gender. Gems just behave like gems. They aren #8217;t masculine or feminine, they just *are*. But put them in a human setting, and they are fixed to adopt our labels and language. None of them are female, but they all use #8220;she/her #8221; pronouns because when comparing themselves to humans, #8220;female #8221; is the closest to how they are seen by humans.

**TL;DR: Girl id known most if my life stole money from me** When I turned like 15, I got some money as a gift, and I had put it all together in a card on a desk in my bedroom. This girl I #8217;d known since primary school, who lived just across the road from me, came over to say happy birthday. It was a little weird, because while we had always been *friendly*, I wouldn #8217;t have considered her a *friend*. We were talking in my room, and I went to see her out, but I left the room first, and she took a few seconds longer than needed to follow me out. I didn #8217;t think anything of it at the time. Later that evening I had gotten more money and went to put it with the rest. I counted it out and realised #163;20 was missing. She was the only person who had been in my room that day. Even my younger sister was away at a sleepover. This girl had stolen from me. From my bedroom. On my birthday. She denied it and her mum believed her. My nan gave me another #163;20 and told me she got it back but I knew she way lying to make me feel better. The next day in school the bitch has the audacity to *sit right next to me* in class and act like nothing happened. I basically threatened her in front of the class and made a very loud point about what she had done, and what I thought of her, and that I wanted my money back. I wanted to embarrass her infront of the class. She wouldn #8217;t move so I stood up aggressively but the teacher got involved and made her move. Later in the hall I cornered her and told her I didn #8217;t want her near me again. She stayed away from me after that.
